1. Regarding tmux + kak, its better to just install the kitty terminal... Heck, its the most awesome terminal I've ever used. Then you won't need tmux at all.
2. The momentum in kak, (as awesome as the software itself is) is kinda... slow or dead... I think it's because there're waaaay less people working on kak and kak-lsp. The fixes come in 2-4 years... which means we've to probably implement the stuff we want ourselves.
3. Listing the stuff - 1. A better implementation for the lsp-hover in kak-lsp and 2. Figuring if the problem in unicode auto-complete lies within kakoune or kak-lsp, and then fixing it.

text: I think that the kak-lsp repo has definitely some dev movement. But ye, we have special needs, so likely we need to take care on our own. However, the pandemic situation is killing all my spare time getting teaching material digitally with Pluto and stuff. Still I'm down to get started with kak-lsp and the internal structure of kakoune. I'd guess that the problem is still in kak-lsp with the unicode autocomplete. Probably some protocol things are slightly off. There was the same problem in a prior release, which is why I advertised a recent `kak-lsp` version in the tutorial of LanguageServer.jl
